It took one morning in high school spent shadowing a speech-language pathologist for Stacy Rockman to know this was the career path for her. Fast forward to current day, Rockman, speech-language pathologist (SLP) at Research Triangle Charter Academy (RTCA), was recently recognized as an Educator of Excellence at the North Carolina Exceptional Children Conference on behalf of the State of North Carolina.

For Rockman, the most rewarding part of being an SLP is also the reason she is so passionate about what she does.
“I truly enjoy seeing the growth these children make with their communication,” said Rockman. “I love seeing their confidence in finding their ‘voice’ and learning how to use it, whether that be through growing their language or social skills, improving their intelligibility, or giving them a means to communicate through augmentative and alternative communication.”

Congratulations on this wonderful accomplishment, Ms. Rockman!

ATTENTION RISING 7th GRADE FAMILIES:
Please be aware of required immunizations for your rising 7th grader. Under North Carolina’s newest vaccine requirements, law (§ 130A-152), all students entering 7th grade must have a Meningococcal Vaccine (MCV) and TDap vaccine (tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis). If your child received a TDap in 6th grade, another one is NOT needed. However, the Meningococcal Vaccine (MCV) would still be required.

If your child has already received both vaccines and you have submitted immunization records to the school, thank you, no further action is needed. If your child has NOT received the above vaccines, please complete and submit immunization records BEFORE the first day of school, August 26th.

If unsure whether or not you’ve submitted your child’s immunization records or for any further questions, please contact our school registrar, Ms. Shannon Tabron at (919) 957-7108 or via email at 40.stabron@nhaschools.com.”
